intro: Habenella leonensis, commonly known as the Leonese habenella, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its foliage is often lance-shaped with a smooth texture, and it produces vibrant blooms in shades of red and orange. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
